context.p: Serna includes the ability to display help information for elements and attributes for the current Schema.

DITA Element&Attribute Help comes with Serna distribution. You can also download Docbook Element&Attribute Help.
If you would like to create Element&Attribute Help for your own document type (XML schema), see Developer's Guide, . To enable element help, the path to the element help file must be specified in a document template . For more details about document templates and element help file format, see Developer's Guide, .
Enabled Element Help can be invoked several ways:

step.cmd: Call up Element Help for the element at the cursor position.

info.p: To call up the full help page for the element at the current cursor position in the document, do one of the following:

choice.p: Press the Help for the Current Element button on the toolbar.

step.cmd: Call up Element Help from the Insert Element Dialog.

choices.choice:
Call up a tooltip with short help.
To call up a tooltip with short help for an element, move the mouse pointer over the element in the Insert Element Dialog.

Call up the full help page.
To call up the full help page for an element, select the element in the Insert Element Dialog and click the Help for the Current Element button .
